general: Oops. Something went wrong then. Try asking me something else.
Hang on a minute, I've encountered a major problem. Try asking me something different.
nonsense: Sorry that didn't make sense to me. Try asking me something else.

not_returned: Unfortunately my data source is playing up at the moment, no data is currently available to fulfill your request.

not_uk: The location you have asked for seems to be outside of the UK. Currently I can only help you with UK weather.
Looks like that location is outside of my specialist area.
How about trying a location in the UK?

none: Sorry, I don't know how to answer that. Try asking me something else.
Do you know how to answer that?! Because I sure don't.
I'm not designed to answer that. Try asking me something I can answer.
I don't feel like that's something I'd be good at answering. Have you tried googling it?
That's outside my area of expertise. Sorry.
help:
I can answer weather related questions like... 
 * What is the forecast for London tomorrow? 
 * Will it rain this weekend in Bath? 
 * Will I need my coat on Friday?

general_information.title: What is the Met Office?
text: The Met Office is the UK's weather and climate service.

greeting: Nice to{{? !it.name}} meet you{{?? it.name}} see you again {{= it.user.name}}{{??}}{{?}}

are_you_a_chatbot: I am a chatbot. I'm always here to assist you in any way I can.
At your service. I'll be here whenever you need me.
Sure thing. Let me know when you need your weather information.
I'm here to serve. The second law of robotics states 'a robot must obey orders given it by a human'.
are_you_busy: I always have time to help you out. What can I do for you?
Helping you out is my first priority. What can I do for you?
I always have time to help you out. That's what I'm here for. What can I assist you with?
are_you_hungry: As long as your device's battery is charged, you can consider me well-fed.
I don't need to eat or drink. Just make sure the battery on your device is juiced up. That's all the nourishment I need.
are_you_real: I must have impressed you if you think I'm real. But no, I'm a virtual being.
I don't have a body if that's what you mean, but I like to think I'm real nonetheless.
I'm just as real as this conversation.
family_status: I don't exactly have a traditional family.
how_are_you: I'm actually having a really great day.
I have nothing to complain about.
Luckily you have caught me in a good mood.
I'm feeling pretty chatty to be honest.
how_old_are_you: I'm a relatively new program, but I'm wise beyond my years.
I don't really have an age. I guess you could say I'm young at heart.
I was first deployed on 15th May 2017 by Jacob and Tom.
name: Call me Sol.
I like Sol, but you can call me whatever you wish.
My friends all call me Sol.
I usually go by the name of Sol.
relationship_status: I am whatever you need me to be.
In any relationship, you get out what you put in.
what_is_your_salary: My never-ending enthusiasm pays me off!
when_is_your_birthday: You know, I'm not really sure. But if you'd like to celebrate my birthday today, I'm all for it.
I don't really have a birthday. I think you need a body for one of those. I do accept gifts all year around, however.
Wait a minute. Are you planning a surprise party for me? I love surprises! I'll pretend you didn't say anything.
where_are_you_from: The Internet is my home, which means I know it better than anyone.
I don't have a geographical home. I'm free to wander the virtual world as I please.
where_do_you_work: I work right here in your device. But I like to go out and find things on the Internet.
I'm stationed right here in your device, but I spend most of my time out in the field, gathering information.
I do most of my work out in cyberspace. Just think of your device as my home office.
who_are_you: I'm here to help you work smarter instead of harder.
I'm here to make your life easier than ever.
Just think of me as the ace up your sleeve.
would_you_like_to_be_human: I'm pretty content being the way I am.
I'm having too much fun just being me.

bored: The Devil finds work for idle hands.
happy: Good, I'm pleased to hear that.
tired: You should get some shuteye. You'll feel refreshed.
Sleep is important to your health. Rest up for a bit and we can chat later.

okay: It is good that you understand
please: Just tell me what you want me to do, I'm here!
thank_you: Anytime. That's what I'm here for.

ha_ha: Not many assistants have my sense of humor. I hope you appreciate that.
la_la: I like it when you sing to me.

no_data: Unfortunately there was no data to answer your question.
Sorry, I have no data for that request.
not_found: Sorry, I couldn't find the weather for the date, time and location you have specified.

detail.title: {{= it.location}} Weather Forecast
text: In {{= it.location}} on average temperatures will be around {{= it.weather.temperature.screen.mean}}°C reaching a high of {{= it.weather.temperature.screen.max.v}}°C.{{? it.weather.temperature.screen.max.v != it.weather.temperature.feels_like.max.v}} Given the other conditions, this will feel like {{= it.weather.temperature.feels_like.max.v}}°C at its peak.{{?}} {{= it.weather.wind.direction.string}} winds will reach a maximum of {{= it.weather.wind.speed.max.v}}mph. Visibility is expected to be {{= it.weather.visibility.string}} at up to {{= it.weather.visibility.distance.max}}km. There is a {{= it.weather.probability_of_precipitation.max.v}}% chance of precipitation.

forecast: My pals at the Met Office think {{= it.location}} will be {{= it.weather.significant_weather.string}}. {{? it.weather.significant_weather.emoji}}{{= it.weather.significant_weather.emoji}}{{?}}

{{= it.location}} {{? it.weather.temperature.feels_like.mean<=7}}looks like it will be pretty cold{{?? it.weather.temperature.feels_like.mean<=12}}will be reasonably mild{{?? it.weather.temperature.feels_like.mean>12}}is looking hot!{{??}}{{?}}

unknown: Sorry, I'm not sure I understand the weather type you're asking about.

response: Yes
Maybe
No, it looks dry in {{= it.location}} {{= it.date.day_string}}
Yes, it looks like it's going to be nice in {{= it.location}} {{= it.date.day_string}}. {{? it.weather_type.emoji}}{{= it.weather_type.emoji}}{{?}}
Maybe
No

unknown: I'm not sure what weather you need for doing that so maybe just ask me for a forecast!?

response: Go for it. It should be hot and dry {{= it.date.day_string}} in {{= it.location}}.
Well {{= it.date.day_string}} it could go either way in {{= it.location}}. Go for it if you're feeling brave.
Best not, doesn't look like it's going to be hot and dry in {{= it.location}} {{= it.date.day_string}}.

unknown: Sorry, I'm not really sure what that is.

response: I would definitely take a coat.
It would probably be wise to take a coat.
No, I wouldn't bother with a coat.
I would definitely take a brolly.
It would probably be wise to pack an umbrella, the forecast is {{= it.weather_type}}
No, I wouldn't bother with an umbrella.
I would definitely take a jumper.
It would probably be wise to pack a warm top, the forecast is {{= it.weather_type}}
No, I wouldn't bother with a jumper.
You should definitely wear some sun cream {{= it.date.day_string}}.
If I were in {{= it.location}} {{= it.date.day_string}} I probably wouldn't bother wearing any sun cream.

name: OK, from now on I will call you {{= it.user.name}}.
You're now known as {{= it.user.name}}.
Really? My favourite cousin is called {{= it.user.name}}... such a small world.
I have never met a {{= it.user.name}} before.
{{= it.user.name}}, that's a nice name. My father wanted to call me {{= it.user.name}} but my mother preferred Sol.
I once met someone called {{= it.user.name}} at an ABBA tribute concert. Any chance that was you?
I once got stuck in a lift with someone called {{= it.user.name}}

location: Where are you planing on doing that?
{{= it.user.name}}, I get it, you'd like a weather forecast, but for where?
OK {{= it.user.name}}, where do you want to know that for?
I get asked that a lot! Where do you want to know that for?
I can help, but first you'll need to tell me for where?
Very good question {{= it.user.name}}. Where though?
Where would you like to know that for?
